headline: Baked Beans
description: A little sweet, a little spicy! Canned pork 'n beans are taken to new heights with the addition of bacon, brown sugar, onion, and a few basic condiments.
name: Baked Beans
recipeIngredient: 2 (15 ounce) cans baked beans with pork

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Combine canned beans with pork, brown sugar, onion, ketchup, mustard, Worcestershire sauce, vinegar, salt, and pepper in a 9-inch square baking dish. Place bacon slices over top.
Bake in the preheated oven until sauce is thickened and bacon is cooked, about 1 hour.

review.reviewBody: Exactly how my mother makes them. I did cut back on the sugar, I didn’t want anyone’s glucose levels to spike. Still, just as good with a “tad” less sugar.
Easy way to dress up canned beans. I used Bush baked beans original flavor which is already really good, but this takes it to the next level. Great for potluck, which is what I b
Love the flavors of this recipe! My family does too. We have made it quite a few ties now, def will keep it in our favorites.
Very delicious!

I used the recipe but made it my own. I used 2 cans of tri blend beans instead but kept the other ingredients the same. I also simmered it on the stove. The flavor was excellent. I love this simple, easy recipe that is exploding with flavor.
The Best basic baked Bean recipe. I added chopped bell pepper and onions. SO GOOD!

Oh my goodness were these bean good! I brought them to our family 4th of July cookout! Even my 2 grands loved them! There was not a bean left in the bowl! The only thing I did differently was add a 1/2 Teaspoon of Liquid Smoke. I just love smoke flavor in my baked beans. These recipe is definitely a keeper! Thanks for sharing!!!! I appreciate on the reviews as well!

This was a good base. I followed the instructions exactly the first time and modified the next and was pleasantly surprised. I ran out of the pork and beans cans from the first attempt. I soaked pinto beans overnight. I had pork shoulder chunked up and deforested so I took about 3 oz and cut it into about 1/2 inch bits and cooked that and 1 lb of bacon in the same cast iron until nearly crispy. I added the onion to the mixture and when the bacon was crispy and onions caramelized, I removed the heat and added the brown sugar, about 1/4 teaspoon of chipotle chili pepper, 1/2 teaspoon smoked paprika, 1/8 teaspoon of Mexican chili powder and 1/8 teaspoon of cayenne. I put this mixture and the rest of the ingredients into my instant pot so as to not take chances with raw beans. Pressure cooked for 1 hr 20mins. Very delicious, a huge hit.

These were the best baked beans that I have made in a while. The flavor turned out slightly sweet and just a little spicy, and the only issue I had was that the sauce was kind of runny. Not exactly sure how to fix that, but I’ll play around with the recipe a little. Tasted great though!

Awesome base recipe for easy baked beans. I double everything except for the brown sugar. I used bacon end pieces I get from a local butcher and fry them first with the onion before adding. I also drained the extra juice from the canned beans.

Every time we’re invited to a barbecue type potluck I’m asked to bring these. We even had a taste test here yesterday, bushes baked beans versus bushes baked beans done with this recipe. This one definitely won hands down
These are good. Very sweet.

I actually forgot I was out of brown sugar. and on a whim I used maple syrup. 
It turned out amazing!

This is a good recipe that adds flavor to your bake beans. I prefer a less sweeter version, so I changed a few things. First I doubled the beans, then I used a good BBQ sauce instead of ketchup. I also added a tablespoon of liquid Smoke and 1 1/2 teaspoon of New Mexico Red Chili powder. This gave a deeper savory, complex flavor!
Used this recipe several times. I make these beans in my smoker and everyone loved them as much as the smoker meat. Never tried the oven version but sure it is a!most as good.

I never rate recipes.....that being said I will never do beans another way!!!!!! I used the cheap cans of pork and beans and just drained one of them. No problems it being runny or anything. Truly thank you for this recipe!
I’ve made this before and it’s amazing! I did a bacon weave on top this time and plan on baking it in the morning as a side for Thanksgiving dinner! Super excited. Thank you
Did not change anything in the recipe and the beans turned out really well. Will make these beans again.

I made too many black and pinto beans for a taco soup, so I used what was left for these baked beans. Even though the wrong beans, it was fantastic. It is probably better with Navy beans, which I'll do next time.
The best baked beans I have ever made. That includes from scratch with dry beans. Fast and easy too.
Very good.

switched ketchup with BBQ sauce. Sauteed the onions with the bacon (and doubled both). Onions caramelized slightly which was awesome. I put a little too much vinegar in so I let it cook for about 30 minutes and it drove it off. I love the vinegar taste but was afraid my guests wouldn't. Everyone loved it.
Do NOT just place the bacon on top...it will Not brown in an hour. I had to broil it before serving and it made the top greasy. Cook the bacon then add it. The recipe was Ok otherwise.
The major change I made was to start with a can of Grandma Brown’s Baked Beans rather than Pork & Beans.
Everyone loved this recipe!
Very good and half the prep time as my old recipe! It will be my go to now.

Very tasty beans! I cut back on the ketchup but added a little molasses and some liquid smoke. Since I did not use the bacon, I didn't have to be concerned about it crisping, so I didn't have to keep it in the oven for an hour. I've found similar recipes on this site, and 35 min or so (without the bacon to cook) worked fine. You get the same or better quality with preparing beans this way then using the dry beans. Saves time and effort. Thanks for this great recipe!
This has become one of my families favorite baked bean dishes

These were surprisingly very good. I halved the recipe because I didn't want to make a huge batch for just me and my husband. I won't be making that mistake again. The recipe is really simple and makes a great side dish too.

I didn't actually make this but I thought I'd chime in on the "soupiness" issue. My mom makes the best pork and beans-based baked beans on the planet. She has no written recipe, she just takes a zen-like approach to it. When it comes to the "soupiness" of the finished product the one thing you need to keep in mind is that different brands of pork and beans often contain different amounts of liquid. Even the same brand can vary from can to can. Mom's able to eyeball it and drain enough liquid (or not) to compensate. It's almost a sixth sense she's developed over the years, and her baked beans always come out perfect! It's just one of those many variables that cooking throws at us and we need to learn how to adjust. Hope this helps!

These are very good! I am used to the real thing but these are a very nice change. Next time I will look for some salt pork or thicker bacon slices and cook lower and slower . I only had time to cook them for 45 minutes. Good recipe!
Mine burned, had to throw it out.
My husband loved these and asked me to use this recipe anytime we want baked beans. I used Bush Original Beans and followed the recipe as is.
No changes
Made this recently, added 6 slices of bacon and cooked in crock pot on high for 3 hours, was delicious. Will definitely make again.
Great foundation recipe. I use a pound of chopped bacon rather than bacon strips. Incorporating the bacon in the beans really gives it a great flavor.
Pretty good, nice side dish to grilled pork chops. Adding it to regular rotation.

3.15.18 Tough to beat these baked beans starting with pork & beans (drained) right out of the can. We eat “less sweet” these days, so I would cut the brown sugar back the next time. I typically add a little O.J. or pineapple juice to my baked beans, and today, I added some juice from my fresh pineapple. I scaled the recipe down to 3 servings and used a small dish. Had I used a larger one, I also would have added a bit of the fresh sliced pineapple on top to cook along with the bacon. No complaints here, good recipe and good beans.

Good, but still too sweet even after reducing the sugar by half. I also drained some of the liquid from the beans and didn't have any problems with "runniness" like others have mentioned. Will likely make again but will reduce the sugar to my taste.
If you add 2 to 2 1/2 tsp. Of liquid smoke, it will taste good. Warning: make sure you do not get a brand that sucks. Read the ingredients.
This is our go to Baked Bean recipe! My family loves it!

I don't eat baked beans, but my friends rave about these, so I have to give it a 5!
I substituted 1/4 c. ketchup and 1/4 bbq sauce for the 1/2 c. ketchup and I also use ham if I don't have bacon (but not always). 
Love this recipe for me, because it is quick and easy.
Way too sweet!
Not a bad way to get a good batch of beans.

I liked it. I may try to add some molasses...it's almost just like my mom's and I think maybe she used molasses too. But overall, this is a really good recipe. (I like to add some cayenne pepper for a "kick.") Thank you for sharing your recipe!
Great baked beans recipe! I made as is and it's great.

After I altered the waaay too much mustard, YIKES! I gave this a 4. I first increased the servings to 12 for a family gathering. I always start with half the ingredients for obvious reasons (except the bacon! :) ) It tasted like total mustard! OMG not a fan! So I kept adding more of everything else and at the end of the day the beans were gone and everyone loved them. So you can just use a teaspoon of mustard and add as you like. Thanks for the basic recipe Jackie, I've never had vinegar in beans but that was a secret ingredient that was amazing, thanks!
The "canned" baked beans ruined it.
Special secret......add a little bacon juice.
Delish. Pulled bacon off and microwaved to crisp and then cut up and mixed into the beans.

In spite of not liking them and never preparing them before...I got stuck with bringing baked beans to a gathering, 

Made this using 2 28 oz cans of baked beans (1 of which I drained) and 1/2 of the sugar called for in the recipe. Received so many compliments that I decided to taste them. They were darn good.
Turned out well. Diced both onion and bacon and sauteed them together before adding them to bean mixture.

Thought this was a good base for making it your own. I used ham, because I had some leftover ham I needed to use. Also switched out the ketchup for molasses, and put it all in the crock pot instead of baking. I also used 1/4 cup coconut sugar instead of brown sugar.
For the last hour of the cooking, I left the lid off of the crock pot, this allowed some of the moisture to escape, and made a thicker sauce. Will make again.
This is excellent! Love the flavor combos!

EASY GOOD. I have lost my own recipe and was 
happy to find this because I believe it is very close.
I followed this recipes ingredients but I did not bake ,
I put in my slow cooker on low for a couple of hours
as I did with my original recipe. Also just added crumbled bacon at end. So Easy, double recipe,
freeze in a mason jar to have on hand for a breakfast with eggs.
I also cut the brown sugar in half; cooked the bacon in advance and crumbled over top

Wonderful. I cut the brown sugar to 1/4 cup. I'm not sure if I'll ever need to try another recipe for baked beans because we loved these. Mine weren't runny at all and I didn't drain the beans, which were Bush's. They were in the oven for a good hour and I did stir them after half an hour.

I used to think MY beans were the best - these surpassed mine!!
A mistake I always made was - making on stovetop- not baking. I found that by baking the 'baked' beans made them thicker and flavorful- 
I did add more bacon- ( i always have cooked bacon pieces in freezer to add to dishes) 
I added some molasses 
Did not find this to be too sweet 
I did do - as others mentioned- drain and rinse beans.

Delicious. Following several reviews, I cut sugar in half. I also drained (though not thoroughly) 2 of the three cans of Bush's beans I used in my 1 1/2 recipe. I used country style mustard and cut up the bacon into small pieces. I added pepper but no salt.
Super yummy!
We enjoyed these. So easy using canned baked beans and just adding things you already have in your pantry. I will definitely make these again.
Love these...I drain the juice out of one of the pork N beans and leave the juice in on the other, this helps to keep it from being runny. Everything else is perfect!

I used Bush's Brown Sugar and Bacon baked beans, added maple pancake syrup to mixture and used BBQ sauce (no Ketchup). I made this for a company potluck, so use a slow-cooker vs. oven, and everyone was asking me for recipe! In slow cooker, cook on low for 3 hours or high for 2 hours.

I'm not a huge fan of baked beans normally, but this came out very well. I had this HUGE can of baked beans sitting in my basement for quite some time, and I ended up using this recipe to prepare it a take it with us to a rental house down the shore we were sharing with my wifes's family for a week. Had to quadruple the recipe for the size of the can, and even with 10 people in the house we ate beans for a week. But everyone seemed to really enjoy them. Very easy to make as well. I would make it again (in a few months when I'm ready to at least look at a baked bean again....)

Everyone raved about these beans at a recent cookout. I used a 55 oz can and eyeballed the measurements. I cooked the onion and bacon before stirring them into the beans then topped the beans with raw bacon. Baked for about 45 minutes until bubbly, then broiled another 5 minutes to crisp the bacon.
I have made it several times and it has always been complimented.
Our favorite baked bean recipe! A definite go to for potlucks. I am often asked for the recipe afterwards. Thanks for the recipe!
Have already made this twice and each time everyone loves it and there are no leftovers.

Very easy recipe. I drained the beans very well. Next time I would bake at 375 degrees in order to evaporate moist texture ( from ketchup and molasses I added) in order to have "sticky beans.". The taste was delicious.

I used to love my mom's baked beans. She just made it with a little bit of this and that and never used a recipe. I was never able to make it like she did until this recipe. This is a perfect match. 

I am so glad to have this now so that I can enjoy the same baked beans I ate as a child.

Plus - it was easy
Minus - it was boring
Won't make again.
My new go to! Delicious.
Been looking for a great baked bean recipe and finally found it!

I made these (a lot of these) for my parents 50th anniversary surprise party. I can't eat them because I am allergic to pork, but I had so many comments from people wanting to know where I got them. Several people told me that they were- best beans they had ever had. I followed the recipe exactly, but omitted the vinegar because I forgot to pick it up when I went to the store.
Easy and delicious!

Love, love, LOVE this recipe!! SO easy to make and it is soooo good! Boyfriend asked for baked beans for a BBQ we had and I found this recipe...a total HIT! Have had 3 requests to make it since I found this recipe a week ago! Definitely a keeper!

I will never have canned baked beans again. These were easy to make and possibly the best baked beans I have ever had. I did not have any baked beans so I used pork and beans. AWESOME! Wish they had 10 stars.
I really like this! I did however make a few changes. I used 4 slices bacon, drain one can of pork and beans of the two, and added a can of giant butter beans for visual interest; drained of course.
loved this but next time i will cut back on the brown sugar. I doubled the recipe and only used half the brown sugar and it was still a little sweet for my taste.
I followed suggestions to cut sugar and catsup in half. Made 1.5 times the recipe, added a bell pepper and a 12 oz package of cooked bacon cut into 1/2 inch pieces. Baked for two hours. Delicious!

Another excellent recipe...Hubby even came back for seconds..

They had an excellent taste.

Made the pork-chop recipe on here to go with them...
This is like the recipe my mother in law always made. I add more bacon. Delicious!
All my peeps Love this! Yum!
We made this for a family gathering and everyone raved about these beans! I did bake longer than an hour (my family likes them cooked down). Definitely worth making again!
I can't eat this, but my husband absolutely loved it. Made it just as stated.

I have to say I was nervous these would be too sweet as I tasted them before baking. However, cooked down they were perfect-my father-in-law raved over them. I did use cannelini beans instead. Will definitely make again.
I made this for a neighborhood party and everyone loved them!
These were good but much too sweet. I wi make them again but next time will use half the amount of sugar.
This is very good my husband and son Loved it. It was quick and easy i made this as written

I just made these baked beans exactly as written, except that I doubled the recipe and baked them in a 9 X 13-inch pan. In fact, they will come out of the oven in 4 minutes. I've already tasted them and they are way too sweet. I would definitely use this recipe again because they have a wonderful flavor, but I would have to cut the amount of brown sugar in half or less. I fixed them for a cookout we are attending in about 30 minutes. I hope our friends like extra sweet baked beans.

Really good recipe overall.
I put this into a crock pot and it turned out great!
It taste a lot better if you add ground beef
I wanted a vegetarian option so I started with vegetarian beans. Then instead of bacon, I added 1/4 tsp liquid smoke to get the bacon flavor.
Best bakes beans I've ever made!

I love the recipes (always a guide) and the reviews, so we can adjust to taste. Halved the ketchup and I used half the amount for brown sugar (dark). More bacon, kept everything else the same. Turned out wonderful, we will be having these again.

I used 2 19 oz. cans Campbell's pork an beans, 1/2 the sugar, the rest of the recipe. I wasn't sure weather to cover while baking. I didn't have much liquid in my mix so covered after 30 min as it looked to be getting dry. Also, chopped up SIX pieces of bacon and mixed in. Yummy!

I've used this recipe a few times and always get rave reviews. After a few attempts, I've decided there is a better balance of flavors if either the canned beans are doubled or the other ingredients are halved. And the bacon? Just about impossible to have too much!

For the ease if making this and the taste that comes out is why get 5 stars. Quick easy and good! Some other recipes out there that may taste a bit better, but no way are they this easy to make with almost everything already in the pantry.

I halved the recipe, and I didn't put any onions in it.. as some reviewers did, I used apple cider vinegar. I thought it was a little too tart, maybe less mustard? This has potential with a little more work.
